fields.description: Small UI improvement - we should remove the 'Full Name (username)' table header from the 'edit watchers' page, since it is redundant as the panel already has a 'Watchers' title.
fields.summary: On Watchers page, remove redundant 'Full name (Username)' header

fields.description:
Not obvious how to access voter & watcher lists.

The links from the operations menu need to be highlighted to indicate that further options are available - possible icons?
fields.summary: Not obvious how to access voter & watcher lists.

fields.description: Currently we have an 'Emails' tab, with no indication of its intended purpose, or how to get emails into it.  There is an EmailHandler which does this, but it doesn't appear to be able to limit email creation to a single project, or have any of the other flags that CreateIssueHandler has.
fields.summary: Do something with the Emails tab

fields.description: Since 3.0, comments have for some reason gained an extra border.  See screenshot.
fields.summary: Double border around comments
Single email notifications for bulk edits

fields.description: When the "remember my login on this computer" box is checked, Jira does not autofill the form on next occurrence.
fields.summary: 2.6.1 #65 does not autofill userid/password when box checked
Transferring settings through issue linking

fields.description: "Create Shared Filter" permission is not granted to jira-developer group by default on setup (previous releases granted this permission).
fields.summary: "Create Shared Filter" permission is not granted to jira-developer group by default

fields.description: The "browse projects" page is not formatted correctly for multiple projects.
fields.summary: "Browse Projects" page is not formatted correctly for multiple projects.
Enhance Seraph SSO support to create users automatically
Notification message cleanup service

fields.description:
Here are a few this that are broken in 3.0-preview:

- If multiple dashboards exist, a full configure opertaion returns to a wrong dashboard configuration screen
- When editing a dashboard interactively (not through full configure) the dashboard, and then going to full configure screen, the old dashboard configuration is restored. That is, the changes made through interactive configuration are lost.
- The portlets that need no input parameters still have the "edit" icon and link active in the interactive configuration. The link does not do anything.
- Manage portal page has a column heading "Operations" missing
- When adding a portlet to a page the "Currently configured" total reflects the number of portlets of that type currently configured on the current dashboard. Need to clarify the fact that the number is only a total for one dashboard page.
- Portlet names are not shown in the "Configure Dashboard" page
- Portlet descriptions are not shown correctly - need to be internationalized
fields.summary: Multiple dashboards and portlets problems

fields.description: Porject categories are only availabel in Enterprise edition of JIRA so the user should not be quiried about them when adding the portlet.
fields.summary: Project portlet asks about project categories in non-enterprise edition

fields.description:
There is usually a large blank space between a linked issue's summary snippet and the linked issue status icon.  This is because the summary is cut off at a hardcoded (fairly short) length.

Rather, we should use <span style="width:90%; overflow:hidden"> to dynamically alter the amount of summary text shown.
fields.summary: UI Improvement: display as much linked issue text as possible

fields.description:
When a workflow is saved as XML, the name and description should be saved with it, and if the user doesn't explicitly provide an overriding name/description, these should be used.

Currently, only the description is saved in the XML, and when importing it is lost.
fields.summary: Workflow editor: when importing from XML, use name/description from XML

fields.description: Currently on the transition screens, the submit button is called 'Update'.  It would be nice if it instead used the name of the transition, eg. 'Validate', 'Question', 'Approve'.
fields.summary: Workflow transition screen: button should contain transition name

fields.description: Say I wish to rename the "Close" transition to "Sign Off". It can be done by deleting the Close transition and creating a new one, but the new transition's notification will be 'genericevent', not 'closed', so the email notification will be misleading.  It would be nice if the transition editor let one set the workflow event type from a list.
fields.summary: Workflow editor needs to be able to set notification type

fields.description:
A user complained that JIRA was not responding -- the port was listening, but the page was not being returned. I investigated, but all I saw in catalina.out was a "Starting log" message from CVSRepositoryUtilImpl from rouhgly 7 minutes ago. After about another three minutes of waiting, the page returned and a large number of exceptions were thrown. After this period, JIRA seems to be running as usual. I'm running Enterprise 2.6.1 on Linux, backed by MySQL on the same box. I'll attach my catalina.out to this bug -- let me know if you need anything else.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4290].
  {panel}

We regularly transfer issues between projects - mainly because

1) we have a pre-approval project
2) we use Jira to log support issues

so issues from both these sources might be moved to development.

We would like to be able to assign development staff while moving the issue to development - generically, any edit might be useful to other people.
fields.summary: Allow editing (particularly assignment) during move

fields.description:
The Scheduler Administration page shown that no trigger has executed since about  16/Aug/04 12:50 PM. The current date is 24/Aug/04.

From previous experience I know that restarting tomcat will restart the scheduler however I don't want to do that. I want to know how the scheduler can be fixed so that it does not die after a while.

The last automatic backup was this: 2004-Aug-16--1250.zip. These backups should be happening every 720 minutes.

The mail queue just keeps growing. I don't want to restart tomcat as I believe this will lose the pending messages. This has been happening for a while, after each tomcat restart. It is only today that I noticed the scheduler was inactive. I suspect the dead scheduler is the cause of this.

Can a jsp be supplied for me to use to restart the scheduler?

I have marked this as critical as the email notifications are a critical part of our business. Currently this is not reliable.

I have noted JRA-2671 "quartz scheduler can die" but since I'm running 2.6 Pro it may not be the same issue.

Below I have posted the Scheduler Administration page details
 and the Services page details.

Below that is an extract from catalina.out around the time of the last scheduled backup, i.e. the last time the scheduler executed a job. There are two classes of entry in this log extract. The first is an entry that occurs thousands of times in the day leading up the death of the scheduler and the second class of entry is toward the end. Search for this to find it

fields.description:
Less is more. I'd like to customize the wordy page operations from this:

* Assign this issue
* Attach file to this issue
* Attach screenshot to this issue
* Comment on this issue
* Delete this issue
* Edit this issue
* Link this issue to another issue
* Move this issue to another project
* Watching: You are not watching this issue. Watch it to be notified of changes
Worklog:
* Worked on this issue? Log work done 

To something like this (also would like to re-order):

* Assign 
* Add Comment 
* [x] Watch (on/off)
* Add to Worklog
* Attach file | screen 
* Link to another issue
* Move to another project
* Edit 
* Delete 

I realize other folks might not want these names/order... so maybe this could be a Velocity template snippet that is customizable by Project Admins?

Cheers,
Tim

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4281].
  {panel}

Actually -- this applies to all email addresses in JIRA, but it's most painful on the Admin account.

One cannot put in an RFC 822 address... for ex:

"Jira Administrator" <tcolson@cisco.com>

http://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc822.html

So emails coming from JIRA can only have "tcolson@cisco.com"... which isn't nearly as informative/pretty for users.

Cheers,
Timo
fields.summary: System admin from address cannot be RFC-822 formatted

fields.description:
This is an RFC-822 compliant address:
Tim Colson <tcolson@cisco.com>

This is RFC-822..been around for over 20 years... explains how email addresses should look, feel, smell, taste. 
http://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc822.html

This is what is put into the Reply-To header by JIRA:
Reply-To: Tim, Colson, tcolson@cisco.com

Which is correctly, albeit badly, interpreted by an RFC822 compliant email app as THREE addresses -- two of which will fail.
Tim; Colson; tcolson@cisco.com

Naughty Jira. ;-)
Timo
fields.summary: RFC-822 email addresses not parsed correctly

fields.description:
Today was the first time I used the System Feature to send a System Wide email to users letting them know I plan to upgrade Confluence. 

(err..no, it was in the Options & Settings, not System, which itself is not so intuitive... but I digress)

The email was sent -- but all of the ID's are put into the TO: field! 

Bad Jira. Baaaad. Naughty Jira!

I want all addresses in the BCC so that my recipients don't inadvertently hit REPLY-ALL and spam each other.

I also do not want all users to see who is in the system. That's for me to know, and them not to know. Simple.

Please think about fixing this. ;-)

Thanks,
Timo
fields.summary: Send Email using BCC field instead of TO

fields.description:
After releasing a new version, tickets that are moved to a different release continue to show up on the changelog for the first release.


Steps to reproduce:

- File 10 issues towards version "Beta 0.9"
- Resolve 8 of the 10 issues
- Release version "Beta 0.9" using "Edit Release Versions"
- Jira will prompt what to do with the 2 tickets that are not resolved.  Specify move to version "Beta 0.9.1"

Results:
- If the two individual tickets are viewed, they will both show a Fix Version of "Beta 0.9.1", which is the expected behaviour.
- However, if the Changelog report is run, the two tickets still show up as unresolved in the "Beta 0.9.0" changelog.  This is incorrect.

Expected results:
- Only the tickets with a Fix Version of "Beta 0.9.0" displayed in the "Beta 0.9.0" changelog.

Reproducability: Always.

Workaround:
- By Re-indexing Jira, the changelog report will display properly.  However, this shouldn't be required.
fields.summary: Moved tickets show up in wrong version of changelog after release

fields.description:
This problem happens when the current version of the file has one digit more than the previous version. E.g.:

src/java/nl/contrado/web/actions/OrderManagerAction.java - Rev. 1.100  (+19 - 17 lines)

The diff link is as follows:

http://<servername>/viewcvs/ordermanager/build/src/java/nl/contrado/web/actions/OrderManagerAction.java?r1=1.099&r2=1.100

When I click this link I get:

ERROR: rcsdiff did not return the correct version number in its output. (got "1.99" / "1.100", expected "1.099" / "1.100")

Aborting operation. 


The problem is the "1.099" of the previous version. I think this should be 1.99, because that is what viewCVS uses as link:

http://<servername>/viewcvs/ordermanager/build/src/java/nl/contrado/web/actions/OrderManagerAction.java.diff?r1=1.99&r2=1.100


In case of a version 1.10 the previous version is 1.09. This causes the same problem as above.

In the workflow step editor, it is not obvious why a step cannot be deleted, until you realize that it's because other steps have transitions to the step. Eg. the 'In Progress' step isn't deletable because we have a transition:

Start Progress  (4)   (view  | del  )
>> In Progress

It would be nice if the "Delete step" link were always present, and if clicked when transitions are present, cause the transition text (the ">> In Progress" text) to flash, and nothing else happen.

fields.description:
We are really starting to groove on where Jira & Confluence are right now.  One thing that would be another sweet addition to the family would be a time-sheet/management facility.  Its not a hard project, we're using Time-Assistant (www.time-assistant.com), and when you look at the simple mechanics involved, and what you are already tracking in Jira; I end up seeing this nice evolution of product families (HR/Resource Management).

As of now though, since we do use a greater detail of time-sheets/tracking we are unable to use Jira's time capabilities.

fields.description:
JIRA 2.6 always displays the title before the portlets.  JIRA 3.0 displays the title if there is only one dashboard (to preserve the existing appearance), but once more than one portlet is configured, the title disappears, on the assumption that people with multiple dashboards know where they are.  However this assumption isn't true for shared, customer-facing dashboards, or installs where you may wish to display the title regardless of chosen dashboard.

Perhaps we should have a 'title' portlet, and let the user choose where to position this, and on which dashboards.

See Mike for more on this issue..
fields.summary: Need to decide how to handle title with multiple dashboards

fields.description:
Steps.
1. Create Seperate workflow
2. Creaet Workflow scheme assign "new" workflow to Single Issue Type.
3. Create an Issue with Different Issue Type.
4. Move Issue to status that is not in the "new" workflow.
5. Edit Issue, click Move Issue link (Should default new project to current project)
6. List of new Statuses was incorrect (Current Workflow not new one)
7. Picked on and continued.
8. Issue has Issue Type changed but not Status.

Outcome is that the Issue can not be moved through workflow as its current step never has any transitions.
fields.summary: Moving Issue to the Same project with different Issue types doesn't seem to work.

fields.description:
I was checking the links for new statuses worked correctly in the Browse Project page.
When i clicked on a new status I got a page saying that that project didn't exist.  
I then did a search in Issue Navigator (worked fine).
Went back to Browse project and status links worked fine.

It seems to be if there is no SearchRequest in the session then the links from that page return a "No Project" error.
fields.summary: Strange Browse Project/Issue Navigator bug

fields.description:

1. Create or Copy a Workflow
2. Create a new workflow scheme
3. Assign Workflow to a single Issue Type only.
4. Assign Workflow to Project.
fields.summary: Error when assigning Incomplete workflow scheme

fields.description:
On the "Edit Version Releases" administration page, it would be great to be able to multi-select from the "Unreleased Versions" box to release multiple versions simultaneously. We have something like 100+ versions and when migrating from Bugzilla, it is painful to release them all manually one at a time. I'm aware there's a separate request around Bugzilla migration, but this request is distinct from that - the functionality should exist in admin regardless.

Note that multi-select on the "Released Versions" list box is possible, allowing you to "Unrelease" multiple versions at once.
fields.summary: Allow multi-select in Edit Version Releases admin page Unreleased Versions box
It would be nice to be able to save issues as "draft"

fields.description:
When you save a issue when the re-indexing is in progress the data sent to the server is lost. I didn't manage to let the browser post the data again to the server.

I think the server should somehow let the browser retry posting the save-action every minute or so (and telling the user so).
fields.summary: save issue during re-indexing causes data-loss

fields.description:
Currently we are evaluating Jira Enterprise. We have started with the system as is. A userid, lets say U, has created issues. Fine so far.

We have then added an issue security level 'Internal'. Userid U from jira-user-group (not in developers, neither in administrators) got access to 'internal' level and was added to the developer profile 'set issue security'.

After that U was no longer able to create issues. 'Create Issue, Step 2 of 2' looped from then on.

We have taken the latest changes back (see above) but nothing changed. The 'Create'-Button takes us right back to the top of the screen 'Step 2 of 2'.

Have we done something wrong?
fields.summary: User cannot complete 'create new issue'

fields.description:
Currently if you close all browser windows and then return to JIRA, the "History" popup is reset.

It would be nice if this was persisted across sessions, always maintaining the last 10 issues I've visisted in reverse chronological order.

Each line could also contain a 'time since visited' field.

example mockup screenshot attached.
fields.summary: Recent History Popup - persistance across sessions & more data

fields.description:
From JRA-4219, it sounds like page-break CSS works in IE 6, so we should enable it there: """ I wrote that "Issues are shown running one after the other, not each starting on a new page". In navigator-full.jsp around line 30, there is this html fragment:

Between 2.5.3 and 2.6.1, this was wrapped in a predicate: <% // This seems to work only in Opera, and crash Mozilla. // So print it only for Opera if ( WebRequestUtils.getBrowser(request) == WebRequestUtils.OPERA) { %>

<% } %> I've run a test, and page-break-before: works in Internet Explorer 6 as well as Opera. """
fields.summary: Add page breaks in Full Content view for IE

fields.description:
Similar to issue CONF-1580 - our mail servers all run on non-standard ports to avoid their use by spammers. Appending the port number to the name of the mail server, e.g. my-mail.atlassian.com:26 results in the expected mail server not found error.

Using a JNDI resource is an alternative, but for ease of use it seems like this would be common enough to be useful to people.
fields.summary: Allow users to specify a port other than 25 for SMTP

fields.description:
When you are looking at a list of issues, going to the Full Content view shows the information out of order.

Specifically:
-- All Comments are shown before any issue

-- Some comments are shown in a narrow ( < 1/4 window) column at the left 

-- Issues are shown running one after the other, not each starting on a new page

To reproduce:
1. Browse to any project
2. Bring up a list of issues for that project (eg: Project Summary|Open)
3. Current View|Full Content

We think that things worked properly under our previous installation (2.5.3) but that is not currently running to test this for sure.
fields.summary: Details shown out of order when printing multiple issues

So I couldn't find any way to click on the Attach button which was off the screen.

David.
fields.summary: Can't Attach Screenshot while in 800 x 600 Resolution

fields.description:
After completing working on a JIRA request.
The work is assigned to the next person in the development process.
Unfortunately there is no way for me to see what I have previously worked on.

This would be handy as this is where the development notes will be stored.

The filter option does not allow searching based on worked on by.
Only by current assignee.
fields.summary: Unable to see previously worked on items

fields.description: When configuring notification schemes, people occasionally get confused between 'Current Reporter' and 'Current User' - especially since when creating an issue, they are the same person.  We should change 'Current Reporter' to just 'Reporter', since the word 'current' is redundant, and misleadingly implies that the reporter can change.
fields.summary: Rename Current Reporter to Reporter.

fields.description:
This is probably one of the bigger thorns in my side with administration of JIRA.  

I have multiple business units using JIRA for various initiatives. About 3 of those initiatives currently use jira utilize multiple projects to represent the various business units that the initiative encompasses (setup in this way for more flexibility on user permissions). 

When I have to add a global custom field so that it will show up for each of the business unit projects for a particular initiative, I have to go to the other initiatives Field Schemes and hide this field so it does not show up in those particular projects.

I would like a way to globally set (for all defined field layout schema) a particular field to be either hidden, or shown. 
It would probably make most sense to place this on the Issue Fields (System) page in Admin.

The lack of this feature severly limits the amount individual Field Schemes I would want to allow to be created for future projects.
fields.summary: Allow option to globally hide custom fields through all schema

fields.description:
I have created Project Admin groups for each project, but it would be great if those admins were able to create and maintain groups, and have access to assign permissions for their project notification and permission schemes without affecting global settings.

Hmm... now that I write this, I am wondering if this is a feature already available in Jira Enterprise? 

Thanks,
Tim
fields.summary: Group maintenance features for "Project Admins"

fields.description:
In a prior in house ticketing solution you could assign multiple people to tickets.  We've adopted a 'Hot Potato' workflow with Jira so far, whoever has the ticket assigned to them has the Hot Potato and must assign someone else to the ticket if it needs to bounce from their court.  We do not mind working this way, but it would be nice to have the ability to assign watchers to a ticket from the onset.  There are generally a few set of eyes which should be watching a ticket from its inception, and leaving that up to them to dig into the tickets to watch it themselves is a burden for administration.

In the end it would be nice to see the same assignability that is present in most of jira, ie, having groups/other flexible assign methods.
fields.summary: Add people to the watch list

fields.description:
USE CASE:
Define component leads for a lot, but not all components of a Jira project.

Create an issue, select a component with a set component lead.
Do not change the Assignee field (leave it on Automatic).

EXPECTED:
The issue is assigned to the component lead user.

REAL:
The issue is assigned to the project default user.
The Default Assignee in dialog "Edit Project" is set to Project Lead and cannot be changed (see attached EditProject.jpg)

ANNOTATIONS:
Configuration: see attached file system.txt
We upgraded from 2.5.1 PE to 2.6.1 EE
Tried both scenarios: allow or disallow unassigned issues.
In the jira-manual.pdf for 2.6.1 I did not find any help on this issue.
fields.summary: Document selecting component leads as default assignees.
SQL92 identifiers not quoted before execution via JDBC
